definition: row/line/commercial firm/line of business/profession/to rank (first, second etc) among one's siblings (by age)/(in data tables) row/(Tw) column

to walk/to go/to travel/a visit/temporary/makeshift/current/in circulation/to do/to perform/capable/competent/effective/all right/OK!/will do/behavior/conduct/Taiwan pr. [xing4] for the behavior-conduct sense

sentences.english: He began poor, panhandled , ended in jail.
sentences.chinese: 他開始受窮，行乞，最後坐牢。

sentences.english: Before liberation circumstances forced him into begging.
sentences.chinese: 解放前環境迫使他行乞。

sentences.english: Children are sometimes forced to beg by their own relatives.
sentences.chinese: 有些兒童甚至被他們的親戚逼迫行乞。

sentences.english: They have used up all the money and they have to beg.
sentences.chinese: 他們用光了所有的錢，只好去行乞。

sentences.english: The coin that clatters in my begging bowl.
sentences.chinese: 是一枚硬幣掉落在我行乞的碗裏。

sentences.english: Now there passed one day through the village a poor beggar-woman.
sentences.chinese: 有一天，一個行乞的可憐的女人來到了村子裏。

sentences.english: Why the beggar but a glasses of frame that street beg?
sentences.chinese: 爲何街頭行乞的叫花子卻框個眼鏡？

sentences.english: Idleness is the key of beggary , and the root of all evil.
sentences.chinese: 懶惰是行乞的敲門磚，是萬惡的根源。

sentences.english: But the ultimate danger in panhandling is that we don't give to every beggar.
sentences.chinese: 但行乞的最大風險是我們無法滿足所有的乞丐。

sentences.english: To work is to preserve your honour. It is better than begging.
sentences.chinese: 工作是爲了捍衛自己的尊嚴，總好過行乞。

sentences.english: Derelicts often beg on the streets.

definition: to go begging/to ask for alms
to glean/to collect scraps/to eke out a meager living
to give in charity/to give alms (to the poor)
to seek one's livelihood/to work to support oneself/to earn a living
